name: The Black Watchmen
description: Become a Secret Agent and investigate paranormal activities in this dark Lovecraftian universe. This Alternate Reality Game will have you explore complex puzzles in-game but also in real-life; interacting with real websites, companies, and NPCs that we created as part of our universe.
minimum_requirements: OS: Latest version Memory: 2 GB RAM DirectX: Version 9.0 Storage: 500 MB available space Additional Notes: Screen resolution 1280x720
recommended_requirements: OS: Latest version Memory: 4 GB RAM DirectX: Version 11 Network: Broadband Internet connection Storage: 1 GB available space Additional Notes: Screen resolution 1920x1080

reviews.review_text: Bought on a (slightly drunk) whim. If you enjoy The X-Files, long Wikipedia dives and developing a questionable Google search history, this game is for you.

I love ARG's. So imagine my utter disappointment, when I realised I have just missed over a year of what is arguably the finest ARG I have ever played?  The Black Watchmen somehow slipped under my all-seeing radar, which is incredibly sad. Sad because I have missed out on joining what will no doubt be a superb global effort, of thousands of players all staying up unreasonable hours, just because they are not quite able to understand just what that picture is supposed to represent, and why wings matter,  The game is literally centered around the real world. You use a central tool to receive puzzles and enter answers, and through where clues and information are given out - but the rest is found 'out there', in the real world. Professionally designed websites (that don't immediately stand out as obviously fake) are used, as well as authentic places around the world, are all used to give you that sense of PRESENCE that is sorely missing from other attempted ARGs.  It isn't without minor fault - the occasional typo, but really nothing that you wouldn't see in real websites I assure you!   I've yet to move up the agent rankings. You start off as a Red agent, meaning world interaction is limited to just you initiating email based contact. Later, you can optionally apply for other grades of agent interaction, from email only, to full on creepy - phonecalls in the middle of the night, strange letters in the post... I am absolutely in for that, and will give the required info as soon as I am able!  What I have yet to experience, and I cannot WAIT to do so, is the live events. As you might expect, you collaborate with global agents via IRC, forums, the usual, in order to solve puzzles in real time. Apparently, one agent is picked to experience this in a full-on 'reality show' - I know nothing about this other than what I've read, so I suggest you, dear reader, do the same. I, sadly will never be 'picked' as I am not physically able, which is utterly sad, but nevertheless, I loook forward to the day I can help solve such events.  Being a puzzle game, based around the internet, you are inevitably going to come across spoilers. However, in saying that, I have solved every single puzzle without 'bumping into' any obvious answers, which is nothing short of unbelievable. There are solutions out there, in the exellent Blackwatch Forums, which should be visited daily. The answers to particularly difficult puzzles can be found, but only after you've worked your way though a lot of excellent spoiler hints. This makes you feel like less of a cheater, and more as what you would have experienced had you been around at the time the community was solving it, just as you are now.   The hints are very well done, asking YOU questions rather than just simply giving you the solution. It makes you feel a lot better about seeking help, because you know you were not the only one a bit lost on how to continue - only to find the right track with just a smallest of nudges. (There was one particularly nasty puzzle which I will not spoil, and I needed every clue they gave - and even then I STILL couldnt' immediately solve it - I really had to put the clues together).  In closing, you may initially buy The Black Watchmen, and feel like you didn't get a lot for you cash. But, if you like puzzles, if you like something a little different from the normal, if you understand stressing over a number is fun, and solving a puzzle gives a certain amount of euphoria, you absolutely MUST buy this game.
OH MY GOD!  I'm in CSI.  The game is awesome, very clever and hard as hell ! 42 75 79 20 6e 6f 77

If you like ARGs or solving mysteries then you should definitely be playing this right now. Live missions are fun. Story missions are fun. The community is fun. The phone calls you get (if you so choose) are fun. IRC is fun. Some agents go out to locations for missions and Periscope their journey. They meet up with people and collect intel or other items to relay to the other agents to continue solving whatever puzzle there is at the moment.   You don't have to get super involved, the story missions are easily worth more than the price, but if you do get involved you will be warmly welcomed as we are always looking for more agents to help stop the summoning of mythological creatures by building paper boats and floating them in the pond for Dispatch.

2 Hours in and I'm having a blast! The puzzles are amazing ! you have to know a bit about everything enjoy this, I love it !  This isn't a game for people who give up fast, your gonna end up on a de-railed clue fast. Love how you don't know where this game ends and the real life/internet starts.

Sometimes, it's a bit like you're doing optional homework, but really I deeply enjoy the intellectual side of it - you actually have to think about the theme, topic, what you've learned so far in order to progress and that's exactly what I want out of an ARG. If you're the sort of person who'll happily fall down a wikihole reading about some random cult, then you'll do well at this game.   Additionally, the community around the game is one of the nicest I've come across.

Quite possibly one of the most unique experiences available on Steam today, currently half price while writing this but worth the price of entry even when it's not reduced, provided this style of game appeals to you.
+ The Best Game or Reality Ever!!!!!!!!!!!
I recommend this game if you like outside the box puzzles and a paranormal ARG mythos
this game is A game i love it the reserch and how to do the missions
Sit down for a little puzzle, 4 hours later, I realized the clinic had an address...  Bye guys, I'll remember you all in therapy!
Does not function on linux. Game launches and runs, but crashes when you open the web browser, which is necessary to proceed past the second mission.

I do not recommend purchasing this game, while I am a big fan of AR games in general, this just doesnt have the level of polish required to keep me intrigued and not annoyed. Previous free AR games I have played have an obvious love or devotion from the developers, which this is missing.  My biggest gripe with this game is that input parameters for deciding if you have supplied the answer are so narrow and specific that you can spend many hours in frustration chasing possible answers, only to later realise you already discoved the real answer long ago but didnt use the correct title. For example while 'icecream store' would be incorrect, 'Sunny Farms Ice Cream Store Inc Pty Ltd' would be correct.   A further kick in the teeth however is that the game quickly devolves any complexity into in browser 'flash games', and 'Social Engineering' otherwise known as 'email formating games'.
